entry.title: Reflections on Spain: How Safe is Spain for tourists now?
entry.summary: <div style="font-size: 18px"> “I have a tendency to want to understand everything, everything that people say and everything I hear, even at a distance, even if it’s in one of the innumerable languages I don’t know, even if it’s in an indistinguishable murmur or an imperceptible whisper, even if it would be better that I didn’t understand and what’s said is not intended for my ears, or is said precisely so that I won’t hear it.” -- Javier Marías, A Heart So White (Spanish: Corazón tan

entry.title: The Books I Read in April
entry.summary:
The Books I Read in April | 2023

The blog post was inspired by Cal Newport’s podcast “Deep Questions with Cal Newport” where he regularly reviews the five books he read in the preceding month.

Here are the 2 books I read in April 2023. Of course I read other books (a lot of fiction books, as usual) but because I was hoping to wrap up

entry.title: The Saigon Situation: Is It Even Possible to Survive in Vietnam for Several Weeks As a Tourist If You Think About Its Chaotic Traffic
entry.summary:
Traffic situation

The past two weeks I have been hanging out in Saigon (Ho Chi Minh City), Vietnam. As a first-time visitor, the first few days was hard. I constantly feel overwhelmed by the very chaotic traffic. I wonder whether there’s another term for “chaotic” to describe a more severe choatic situation. Especially during rush hours, it gets really bad.

It’s been two weeks

entry.summary:

entry.title: 11 Days in Japan -- Fukuoka, Saga, Tokyo
entry.summary: The 11-day visit in Japan was full of fun memories. In the first week, I spent several days in Fukuoka, capital of Fukuoka Prefecture (福岡県, Fukuoka-ken) in late November. It was the perfect month for travel. Spent the second week of the trip mostly in Tokyo to catch up with a few friends and meet some new folks in web3/crypto communities in Tokyo. Overall, I really enjoyed the trip. It was my fifth trip to Japan, and it was the longest. I hope I could stay a bit longer (2 weeks,

entry.title: Some notes on Édouard Louis's book Combats et métamorphoses d’une femme
entry.summary: This week, I finished reading Édouard Louis’s book Combats et métamorphoses d’une femme (Seuil, 2021). I enjoyed it very much. It’s a short book published last year in France and now translated in English as A Woman’s Battles and Transformations. In the book, Édouard Louis tells the story of his mother’s struggles of class and gender within a working-class family in northern France.

entry.title: What I’ve Been Up To Lately - Solidity workshop, CS50, Collège de France lectures
entry.summary:
What I’ve been up to lately

This past week I have been quite busied with meeting old and new folks at random coffee shops and restaurants. I’m curious to hear what everyone has been up to. entry.title: Striking up a conversation with a group of people at a coffee shop
entry.summary: I was reading this French contemporary book « Combats et métamorphoses d’une femme » d’Edouard Louis (Seuil, 128 p.,), English translation: A Woman’s Battles and Transformations by Édouard Louis, at a random coffee shop in New Taipei. The English translation was published this summer in August 2022. The original French edition was published a year before in April 2021.

entry.title: Hello November | Do you still read blogs?
entry.summary:
Do you still read blogs?

I still read blogs. In 2022. In fact I read blogs regularly, at least a few times a week. I browse headings and sometimes subheadings of Vitalik’s blog https://vitalik.ca/ and Dankrad’s blog https://dankradfeist.de/. I check out what flyinglimao has been up to by

entry.title: Goodbye October! Devcon Swag Fashion, CS50 Lecture 2 Arrays, Problem Sets
entry.summary:
Devcon was held in mid October this year. The Bogotá, Colombia Edition. I wasn’t there but I did get some swag. Among the stuff I got, a few items stood out to me. Crypto swag fashion item number one. A black cap. With a beautiful blue and purple Ethereum logo on it. I absolutely love it. I’m wearing it every day now. It’s so perfect for Autumn days in Asia.

Crypto swag fashion item number one. A lovely black tote bag. It came from Scroll (a startup that builds native zkEVM layer 2

entry.title: My last trip
entry.summary:
My last trip was a three-month trip to Europe. During the months of April, May, June and July, I visited several small towns and lots of major cities in Europe.

I have been to Europe several times since high school, but I wouldn’t say I know Europe well. The last time I visited Europe was some two years ago when I went to a blockchain conference event in Paris.

entry.title: Using MPC to Help Achieve Blockchain Privacy
entry.summary:
This post answers some of the most commonly asked questions about using multi-party computation (MPC) in blockchains.

What is MPC?

Multi-party computation (MPC) is a cryptographic protocol that does a joint computation involving multiple parties over their inputs while keeping those inputs private.

A famous example of MPC is

entry.title: 8 Days in Palo Alto, California: Stanford Blockchain Conference, Computer History Museum, Shoreline Lake Park, Apple Infinite Loop, and More!
entry.summary: I haven’t been abroad since April because of COVID-19. Not too long, but somehow it feels like a lifetime. I was thinking of the U.S. recently for some reason, I don’t know why I miss my two weeks in the U.S. so much. I thought I just needed to get the story out, or I’ll never come back to it; hence never write it. I’ve got to keep writing – there’s no other way! How else would you reflect yourself?

entry.title: What are some of the most exciting opportunities for front-end engineers unique in the blockchain space?
entry.summary:
What are some of the most exciting opportunities for front-end engineers that are unique in the blockchain sphere? I got this question from a front-end engineer earlier today, on a Monday night (7/27). Thought it was an important question to think about. So I thought, why not ask around and seek insights from the brilliant minds in my professional network?
